com.hcl.domino.json

Interface JsonSerializer


  • public interface JsonSerializer
    This interface allows for serialization of documents into JSON, both as strings and as implementation-specific Java object representations.

    Implementations of this service are expected to be provided by additional integration modules, such as domino-jnx-jsonp.

    Since:
    1.0.7
    Author:
    Jesse Gallagher

      Sets whether property names in the emitted JSON should be lowercased.
      Object toJson(Document doc)
      Serializes the provided document as a JSON object using the implementation's native JSON type.
      default String toJsonString(Document doc)
      Serializes the provided document as a JSON string.

    • Method Detail

      • createSerializer

        static JsonSerializer createSerializer()
        Constructs a new serializer using the first available JSON service.
        Returns:
        a new JsonSerializer implementation
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no registered serializer implementation

      • excludeItems

        JsonSerializer excludeItems(Collection<String> skippedItemNames)
        Exclude items by name.
        Parameters:
        skippedItemNames - a Collection of case-insensitive item names, or null to not exclude any items
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • includeItems

        JsonSerializer includeItems(Collection<String> includedItemNames)
        Include only specific items by name.

        Note: excludeItems(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>) is still applied if both are specified.

        Parameters:
        includedItemNames - a Collection of case-insensitive item names, or null to not include only specific items
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • excludeTypes

        JsonSerializer excludeTypes(Collection<ItemDataType> excludedTypes)
        Exclude item types.
        Parameters:
        excludedTypes - a Collection of item types to exclude, or null to not exclude any item types
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • lowercaseProperties

        JsonSerializer lowercaseProperties(boolean lowercaseProperties)
        Sets whether property names in the emitted JSON should be lowercased. When false (the default), emitted properties will match the capitalization of the first of each named item in the source document.
        Parameters:
        lowercaseProperties - whether to lowercase property names
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • includeMetadata

        JsonSerializer includeMetadata(boolean includeMetadata)
        Sets whether to include a metadata object in the output JSON, using the "@meta" property. false by default.
        Parameters:
        includeMetadata - whether to include a document-metadata object
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • booleanItemNames

        JsonSerializer booleanItemNames(Collection<String> booleanItemNames)
        Sets the item names that should be considered boolean values when serialized to JSON.

        Items of type TEXT, NUMBER, and RFC822_TEXT, as well as single-value items of type TEXT_LIST or NUMBER_RANGE are evaluated for boolean conversion.

        Parameters:
        booleanItemNames - the names of items to serialize as boolean
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • booleanTrueValues

        JsonSerializer booleanTrueValues(Collection<Object> trueValues)
        Sets the values used to determine true and false when serializing items configured via booleanItemNames(Collection).

        All values not specified here will be considered false.

        Parameters:
        trueValues - a collection of objects to compare to resolve as true
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • dateRangeFormat

        JsonSerializer dateRangeFormat(DateRangeFormat format)
        Sets the format for date/time range values.
        Parameters:
        format - the DateRangeFormat type to use
        Returns:
        this serializer

      • toJson

        Object toJson(Document doc)
        Serializes the provided document as a JSON object using the implementation's native JSON type.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to serialize
        Returns:
        an implementation-dependent JSON object

      • toJsonString

        default String toJsonString(Document doc)
        Serializes the provided document as a JSON string.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to serialize
        Returns:
        a string of JSON content
